title: Installation issue: cuda@11.2.1
body:
Hello,

When installing cuda I am hitting this error:

==> cuda: Executing phase: 'install'
Extraction failed.
Ensure there is enough space in /tmp and that the installation package is not corrupt
==> Error: ProcessError: Command exited with status 15:
    '/usr/bin/sh' '/mercury/data2/mhodgkin/spack-stage/spack-stage-cuda-11.2.1-ecqs2wxhculalyf3hqtee2bxgt7fhz7u/spack-src/cuda_11.2.1_460.32.03_linux.run' '--silent' '--override' '--toolkit' '--installpath=/mercury/data2/mhodgkin/spack/opt/spack/linux-centos7-haswell/gcc-4.8.5/cuda-11.2.1-ecqs2wxhculalyf3hqtee2bxgt7fhz7u'
See build log for details:
  /mercury/data2/mhodgkin/spack-stage/spack-stage-cuda-11.2.1-ecqs2wxhculalyf3hqtee2bxgt7fhz7u/spack-build-out.txt

Its unclear from the error whether the issue is /tmp or the package is corrupt. I believe I have setup spack such that it should not try to put anything in /tmp (see my config.yaml below) - but of course its possible I missed something I do not know to specify. The machine has 2 GB available in /tmp and after the first time I saw this issue I read the docs and attempted to use the config to avoid /tmp (in contrast /mercury has 15T available and I would assume should not hit any space issues).

Cheers,

Mark

### Steps to reproduce the issue

<!-- Fill in the exact spec you are trying to build and the relevant part of the error message -->
```console
$ spack install cuda@11.2.1
...
```

### Information on your system

./spack debug report
* **Spack:** 0.16.1-1580-f1d0a819e9
* **Python:** 3.6.8
* **Platform:** linux-centos7-broadwell
* **Concretizer:** original

I have created a config file:

more ../etc/spack/config.yaml 
config:
  build_stage:
      - /mercury/data2/mhodgkin/spack-stage
      - /mercury/data2/mhodgkin/.spack/stage
  test_stage: /mercury/data2/mhodgkin/.spack/test
  misc_cache: /mercury/data2/mhodgkin/.spack/cache

### Additional information
